metadata.title: USN-6836-1 -- SSSD vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that SSSD did not always correctly apply the GPO policy for authenticated users, contrary to expectations. This could result in improper authorization or improper access to resources.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6836-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libipa-hbac-dev - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 libipa-hbac0 - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 libnss-sss - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 libpam-sss - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 libsss-certmap-dev - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 libsss-certmap0 - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 libsss-idmap-dev - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 libsss-idmap0 - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 libsss-nss-idmap-dev - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 libsss-nss-idmap0 - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 libsss-simpleifp-dev - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 libsss-simpleifp0 - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 libsss-sudo - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 libwbclient-sssd - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 libwbclient-sssd-dev - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 python3-libipa-hbac - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 python3-libsss-nss-idmap - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 python3-sss - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 sssd - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 sssd-ad - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 sssd-ad-common - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 sssd-common - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 sssd-dbus - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 sssd-ipa - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 sssd-kcm - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 sssd-krb5 - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 sssd-krb5-common - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 sssd-ldap - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 sssd-proxy - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 sssd-tools - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13 No subscription required
